column1: '''''ando''''' is a noun meaning "gate" in [[Quenya]].<ref name="Names">{{App
column2: Letters}}, Note, ''The names of the letters''</ref>

left]]''Ando'' is also the name in Quenya of the fifth letter of the [[Tengwar]] alphabet.<ref name="Names"/>  It is the first letter of the second grade or [[Tyellë]], which contains "voiced stops" and it is the second letter in the dental or ''t''-series of consonants, the ''[[Tincotéma]]''.<ref name="Letters">{{App
column3: Letters}}</ref>  In the standard spelling of Quenya ''Ando'' represents '''ND'''.<ref>{{App
column4: Letters}}, Note</ref>   In all other modes this letter represents '''D'''.<ref name="Letters"/>  The Westron name for this letter is '''''Dó'''''.<ref>See [[Westron Tengwar]]</ref>

column1: The word derives from the [[Primitive Quendian]] [[Sundocarme
